description: The Bay Laurel (Laurus nobilis) is a hardy, evergreen shrub native to the Mediterranean. This versatile plant is well known for its culinary use as a flavorful herb, but it is also admired for its ornamental features. The glossy, dark green Bay Laurel leaves can be used fresh or dried for a range of culinary dishes. Additionally, it can make a great addition to any garden due to its beauty. The tree can grow up to 4 meters in height and its fragrant yellow flowers will attract pollinators. It is also incredibly easy to care for and can grow in a variety of climates. In conclusion, the Bay Laurel is an amazing plant species due to its unique flavors, ornamental features, and hardy nature.
